title: Understanding Emission Spectroscopy
text: Emission spectroscopy involves analyzing the light emitted by a sample when it is excited by an energy source. Can you think of what happens to the electrons in the sample during this process?

title: Understanding Absorption Spectroscopy
text: In absorption spectroscopy, the focus is on the light absorbed by a sample. What do you think happens to the energy levels of the electrons in the sample when light is absorbed?

title: Energy Transitions in Emission Spectroscopy
text: In emission spectroscopy, electrons in a sample absorb energy and move to higher energy levels. When they return to lower energy levels, they emit light. What is this process called?

title: Energy Transitions in Absorption Spectroscopy
text: In absorption spectroscopy, electrons in a sample absorb light and move to higher energy levels. What happens to the light that is not absorbed?

title: Comparing Emission and Absorption
text: Both emission and absorption spectroscopy involve energy transitions in electrons. How do these transitions differ between the two techniques?

hintAnswer: Emission spectroscopy measures light emitted by a sample, while absorption spectroscopy measures light absorbed by a sample.

text: What is the main difference between emission and absorption spectroscopy?
